title: CFIA-NCFAD/nf-flu pipeline parameters
description: Influenza genome assembly with IRMA and consensus sequence analysis

input_output_options.title: Input/output options
input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

input.description: Sample sheet with sample names and paths to reads.

platform.description: NGS platform used to sequence the samples.

ref_db.description: Provide fasta database of interesting reference sequences

outdir.description: The output directory where the results will be saved.

variant_calling_options.title: Variant calling options
variant_calling_options.description: Various options for the variant calling branch of the pipeline.

medaka_variant_model.description: [Medaka](https://github.com/nanoporetech/medaka) Medaka model for final variant calling from phased reads

medaka_snp_model.description: [Medaka](https://github.com/nanoporetech/medaka) Medaka model for initial SNP calling from mixed reads prior to phasing

major_allele_fraction.description: Major variant allele frequency/fraction. Only major variant alleles are used for generating a consensus sequence.

low_coverage.description: Low coverage depth threshold. Consensus sequence positions with less than this coverage depth will be masked with `N`.

nanopore_options.title: Nanopore options
nanopore_options.description: Options exclusive to running the pipeline on Nanopore data using the ARTIC fieldbioinformatics pipeline.

min_sample_reads.description: Minimum number of raw reads required per sample in order to be considered for the downstream processing steps.

irma_module.description: IRMA module to use for analysis.

keep_ref_deletions.description: Set "DEL_TYPE=NNN" to keep deletions to reference sequence as N characters in consensus.

skip_irma_subtyping_report.description: Skip the output of subtyping report generated by IRMA consensus sequences.

nanopore_illumina_options.title: Nanopore/Illumina options
nanopore_illumina_options.description: Options common to both the Nanopore and Illumina workflows in the pipeline.

skip_mosdepth.description: Skip genome-wide and amplicon coverage plot generation from mosdepth output.

output_unmapped_reads.description: Keep unmapped reads in BAM output. BAM output sizes without unmapped reads may be drastically smaller.

min_aln_length.description: Minimum alignment length of nucleotide BLAST results to consider for getting mismatch report from BLAST result against reference database. We normally set this number around the smallest genome segment (Segment 8).

h_n_subtyping_options.title: H/N subtyping options
h_n_subtyping_options.description: Hemaglutinin and neuraminase subtype prediction options

pident_threshold.description: Minimum % identity of nucleotide BLAST results to consider for determining H/N subtypes.

max_top_blastn.description: Maximum of top blastn result reported

ncbi_influenza_fasta.description: Path/URL to Zstandard compressed NCBI Influenza virus sequences FASTA file.

ncbi_influenza_metadata.description: Path/URL to Zstandard compressed NCBI Influenza virus sequences metadata CSV file.

vadr_model_targz.description: Path/URL to the VADR model tarball (.tar.gz) to use for annotation

generic_options.title: Generic options
generic_options.description: Less common options for the pipeline, typically set in a config file.
generic_options.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.

publish_dir_mode.description: Method used to save pipeline results to output directory.
publish_dir_mode.help_text: The Nextflow `publishDir` option specifies which intermediate files should be saved to the output directory. This option tells the pipeline what method should be used to move these files. See [Nextflow docs](https://www.nextflow.io/docs/latest/process.html#publishdir) for details.

monochrome_logs.description: Do not use coloured log outputs.
monochrome_logs.help_text: Set to disable colourful command line output and live life in monochrome.

tracedir.description: Directory to keep pipeline Nextflow logs and reports.

singularity_pull_docker_container.description: Instead of directly downloading Singularity images for use with Singularity, force the workflow to pull and convert Docker containers instead.

validate_params.description: Boolean whether to validate parameters against the schema at runtime

show_hidden_params.help_text: By default, parameters set as _hidden_ in the schema are not shown on the command line when a user runs with `--help`. Specifying this option will tell the pipeline to show all parameters.

slurm_queue.description: Slurm queue/partition to submit pipeline jobs to

slurm_queue_size.description: Slurm queue size. Max number of jobs to queue at once.

max_job_request_options.title: Max job request options
max_job_request_options.description: Set the top limit for requested resources for any single job.
max_job_request_options.help_text:
If you are running on a smaller system, a pipeline step requesting more resources than are available may cause the Nextflow to stop the run with an error. These options allow you to cap the maximum resources requested by any single job so that the pipeline will run on your system.

Note that you can not _increase_ the resources requested by any job using these options. For that you will need your own configuration file. See [the nf-core website](https://nf-co.re/usage/configuration) for details.

max_cpus.description: Maximum number of CPUs that can be requested    for any single job.
max_cpus.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the CPU requirement for each process. Should be an integer e.g. `--max_cpus 1`

max_memory.description: Maximum amount of memory that can be requested for any single job.
max_memory.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the memory requirement for each process. Should be a string in the format integer-unit e.g. `--max_memory '8.GB'`

max_time.description: Maximum amount of time that can be requested for any single job.
max_time.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the time requirement for each process. Should be a string in the format integer-unit e.g. `--max_time '2.h'`
